sec.p: The labour practices of an organization encompass all policies and practices relating to work performed within, by or on behalf of the organization, including subcontracted work.
Labour practices extend beyond the relationship of an organization with its direct workforce or the responsibilities that an organization has at a workplace that it owns or directly controls.

Labour practices include the recruitment and promotion of workers; disciplinary and grievance procedures; the transfer and relocation of workers; termination of employment; training and skills development; health, safety and industrial hygiene; and any policy or practice affecting conditions of work, in particular working time and remuneration. Work relations and conditions also include the recognition of employee organizations and employer organizations.
